1.name: Casablanca
1.description: A cynical American expatriate struggles to decide whether or not he should help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape French Morocco.

2.name: You Were Never Lovelier
2.description: In Buenos Aires, a man who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age allows an American dancer to perform at his club under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter.

3.name: The Talk of the Town
3.description: An escaped prisoner and a stuffy law professor vie for the hand of a spirited schoolteacher.

4.name: Bambi
4.description: The story of a young deer growing up in the forest.

5.name: Saboteur
5.description: An aircraft factory worker goes on the run after being wrongly accused of starting a fire that killed his best friend.

6.name: Cat People
6.description: An American man marries a Serbian immigrant who fears that she will turn into the cat person of her homeland's fables if they are intimate together.

7.name: The Ox-Bow Incident
7.description: When a posse captures three men suspected of killing a local farmer, they become strongly divided over whether or not to lynch the men.

8.name: Mr. and Mrs. North
8.description: Jerry North (William Post Jr.) and his wife, Pam (Gracie Allen)return home after a night away in a holiday spirit. The spirit soon vanishes when the body of a man falls out of the liquor ...                See full summary »

9.name: The Magnificent Ambersons
9.description: The spoiled young heir to the decaying Amberson fortune comes between his widowed mother and the man she has always loved.

10.name: The Spoilers
10.description: In Nome, Alaska, miner Roy Glennister and his partner Dextry, financed by saloon entertainer Cherry Malotte, fight to save their gold claim from crooked commissioner Alexander McNamara.

11.name: To Be or Not to Be
11.description: During the Nazi occupation of Poland, an acting troupe becomes embroiled in a Polish soldier's efforts to track down a German spy.

12.name: Now, Voyager
12.description: A frumpy spinster blossoms under therapy and becomes an elegant, independent woman.

13.name: Yankee Doodle Dandy
13.description: The life of the renowned musical composer, playwright, actor, dancer, and singer George M. Cohan.

14.name: Mrs. Miniver
14.description: A British family struggles to survive the first months of World War II.

15.name: Jungle Book
15.description: A boy raised by wolves tries to adapt to human village life.

16.name: The Young Mr. Pitt
16.description: This biopic tells the story of the life of Pitt The Younger, who became Prime Minister of Great Britain at the age of twenty-four.

17.name: This Gun for Hire
17.description: When assassin Philip Raven shoots a blackmailer and his beautiful female companion dead, he is paid off in marked bills by his treasonous employer who is working with foreign spies.

18.name: Tombstone: The Town Too Tough to Die
18.description: Wyatt Earp cleans up Tombstone and faces the Clanton gang at the O.K. Corral.

19.name: The Pride of the Yankees
19.description: The story of the life and career of famed baseball player Lou Gehrig.

20.name: The Black Swan
20.description: An ex-pirate contends with rowdy buccaneers and a love-hate relationship with an aristocratic woman who's tougher than she seems.

21.name: The Major and the Minor
21.description: A woman disguises herself as a child to save on a train fare and is taken in charge by an army man who doesn't notice the truth.

22.name: Random Harvest
22.description: An amnesiac World War I veteran falls in love with a music hall star, only to suffer an accident which restores his original memories but erases his post-war life.

23.name: Holiday Inn
23.description: At an inn which is only open on holidays, a crooner and a hoofer vie for the affections of a beautiful up-and-coming performer.

24.name: In Which We Serve
24.description: This "story of a ship", the British destroyer H.M.S. Torrin, is told in flashbacks by survivors as they cling to a life raft.

25.name: Went the Day Well?
25.description: An English village is occupied by disguised German paratroopers as an advance post for a planned invasion.

26.name: Woman of the Year
26.description: Rival reporters Sam and Tess fall in love and get married, only to find their relationship strained when Sam comes to resent Tess' hectic lifestyle.

27.name: I Married a Witch
27.description: A beautiful 17th-century witch returns to life to plague politician Wallace Wooley, descendant of her persecutor.

28.name: Kings Row
28.description: The dark side and hypocrisy of provincial American life is seen through the eyes of five children as they grow to adulthood at the turn-of-the-century.

29.name: The Glass Key
29.description: A crooked politician finds himself being accused of murder by a gangster from whom he refused help during a re-election campaign.

30.name: Tarzan's New York Adventure
30.description: Tarzan and Jane go to New York to rescue Boy after he is kidnapped into a circus.

31.name: Across the Pacific
31.description: In December 1941, ex-army captain Rick Leland boards a Japanese ship heading to Asia via the Panama Canal where his Japanese hosts show interest in the American defense plans for the canal zone.

32.name: White Cargo
32.description: The story takes place at a British plantation in Africa where Tondelayo entices all the Brits, especially Harry Witzel.

33.name: The Man Who Came to Dinner
33.description: When acerbic critic Sheridan Whiteside slips on the front steps of a provincial Ohio businessman's home and breaks his hip, he and his entourage take over the house indefinitely.

34.name: All Through the Night
34.description: Runyonesque Broadway gamblers turn patriotic when they stumble onto a cell of Nazi saboteurs.

35.name: Larceny, Inc.
35.description: Three ex-cons buy a luggage shop to tunnel into the bank vault next door. But despite all they can do, the shop prospers...

36.name: Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon
36.description: Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson must protect a Swiss inventor of an advanced bomb sight from falling into German hands.

37.name: Flying Tigers
37.description: Capt. Jim Gordon's command of the famed American mercenary fighter group in China is complicated by the recruitment of an old friend who is a reckless hotshot.

38.name: Reap the Wild Wind
38.description: Florida ship salvager, Loxi, falls for Jack, captain of a ship wrecked on the Key West shore. However, their romance is complicated by the arrival of another suitor, and eventually leads to tragedy.

39.name: The Seventh Survivor
39.description: Survivors from a torpedoed passenger vessel are rescued by a lighthouse crew. Ironically, the German captain responsible for the attack is also rescued and held prisoner, but a spy among the survivors plans to help him escape.

40.name: Road to Morocco
40.description: Two carefree castaways on a desert shore find an Arabian Nights city, where they compete for the luscious Princess Shalmar.

41.name: The Ghost of Frankenstein
41.description: When Ygor brings the Monster to Dr. Ludwig Frankenstein for care, Ludwig gets the idea of replacing the Monster's current criminal brain with a normal one.

42.name: Tales of Manhattan
42.description: A formal tailcoat that gets passed from one owner to another affects each life in a significant way.

43.name: In This Our Life
43.description: The day before her wedding, a pampered young woman absconds with her sister's husband; in retaliation, her sister begins seeing the woman's former fiancé.

44.name: The Palm Beach Story
44.description: An inventor needs cash to develop his big idea. His wife, who loves him, decides to raise it for him by divorcing him and marrying a millionaire.

45.name: The Goose Steps Out
45.description: A bumbling teacher turns out to be the double of a German general. He is flown into Germany to impersonate the general and cause chaos and hilarity in a Hitler Youth college.

46.name: One of Our Aircraft Is Missing
46.description: When Nazi anti-aircraft fire damages a British bomber, its crew bails out and seeks help from the Dutch underground.

47.name: The Murderer Lives at Number 21
47.description: Inspector Wens moves into a Paris boarding house to catch a serial killer.

48.name: Spitfire
48.description: Aircraft designer/patriot R. J. Mitchell, alarmed at growing German militarism, works to perfect a defense against the German Messerschmidt at the cost of his health.

49.name: Roxie Hart
49.description: Roxie Hart signs a murder confession in order to attract publicity for her dancing career as dames don't swing in Cook County. Will everything go as planned?

50.name: For Me and My Gal
50.description: Two vaudeville performers fall in love, but find their relationship tested by the arrival of WWI.
